meanings.definition: A dry, one-seeded fruit formed from a compound ovary in which the ovary wall is fused with the seed coat.
meanings.sent1: The cypsela of the dandelion easily disperses in the wind.
meanings.sent2: I collected a handful of cypselas from the wildflowers in the field.
meanings.sent3: The cypsela rolled down the hill, playing a game of seed bowling.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like cypselas, each containing a potential solution waiting to be released.
meanings.sent5: The cypsela looked like a tiny treasure chest holding a single seed within.

meanings.definition: A type of fruit that is characteristic of the Asteraceae family, such as a sunflower seed.
meanings.sent1: The cypsela of the sunflower is loved by birds for its tasty seeds.
meanings.sent2: I planted a row of cypselas in the garden to grow beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The cypsela jumped out of the flower, surprising everyone with its seed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright cypsela, radiating warmth and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The cypsela held the promise of new life, waiting to sprout into a vibrant plant.
